body.p: To his Excelency the Governor of the State of Kentucky. Your petitioner Zachariah Tate, says. that he was fined at the present May term of the Clark circuit Court upon indictment for carrying consealed upon his person a pistol the sum of $50. He says the facts are these. he was engaged by James Price to go to the County of Bath, to apprehend a runaway slave in the year 1860 and Price advised him to arm himself and he accordingly did get a pistol and put in his pocket just as he was starting on the business of trying to apprehend said slave, and the handle of it was seen by a witness and the court ruled that the above facts which were all the facts of the case, rendered him liable to judgment, and did not bring him within the savings of the act. of March 11th 1854. 1st Vol. Stanton R.V. statutes page, 414, He says he purchased said pistol for no other purpose than that of protecting his person in the business he entered upon to capture said slave, and he did use it for no other purpose. and it was not his and only borrowed But the court gave a preventory instruction to find against him. He says he has a very large family and is very poor and the fine upon him is oppresive and in fact he cannot pay it. He asks Executive Clemency

Sworn to by Zach'r Tate, May 5th 1864
R. D Davis D C
For A H Buckner clerk

John B Huston states that he defended Tate on the charge named in this petition as a gratuity. Tate being too poor to pay anything and he then and now believes that the spirit and meaning of the savings of the act of 1854 protected Tate. But the Court ruled absolutely for the Commonwealth. The facts set out by Tate in his petition are these He is a very poor man and has a family of twelve children, and not one of them twenty one years of age, and he is a harmless man, and he sincerely recomends him to the favor of the Governor
I think the case one that merits the clemency of the Executive.
We the Jury who fined Tate recomend him to Executive Clemency and only felt constrained by the instructions of the Court to find against him.

B Y Crim
A L Haggord
E C Browning
William Johnston
J. B. Thomos
William Garner

Clarke Cir Ct
vs
Z. Tate
$50

Remit except fees & costs
Thos E Bramlette
concd Weap
5th May/64
